questions.question: A design is made on a rectangular tile of dimensions $50 \text{ cm} \times 70 \text{ cm}$ as shown in the figure. The design shows 8 triangles, each of sides $26 \text{ cm}, 17 \text{ cm}$ and $25 \text{ cm}$. Find the total area of the design and the remaining area of the tile.
questions.diagram: <svg viewBox='0 0 160 120' style='max-width:300px; display:block; margin:0 auto;'><rect x='10' y='10' width='140' height='100' fill='none' stroke='#333' stroke-width='2'/><path d='M 20 20 L 50 20 L 35 45 Z' fill='#e0e0e0' stroke='#555'/><path d='M 60 20 L 90 20 L 75 45 Z' fill='#e0e0e0' stroke='#555'/><path d='M 100 20 L 130 20 L 115 45 Z' fill='#e0e0e0' stroke='#555'/><path d='M 20 60 L 50 60 L 35 85 Z' fill='#e0e0e0' stroke='#555'/><path d='M 60 60 L 90 60 L 75 85 Z' fill='#e0e0e0' stroke='#555'/><path d='M 100 60 L 130 60 L 115 85 Z' fill='#e0e0e0' stroke='#555'/><path d='M 40 90 L 70 90 L 55 115 Z' fill='#e0e0e0' stroke='#555'/><path d='M 80 90 L 110 90 L 95 115 Z' fill='#e0e0e0' stroke='#555'/><text x='80' y='118' font-size='8' text-anchor='middle' fill='#555'>Rectangular Tile with 8 Triangles</text></svg>
questions.answer: Design Area: $1632 \text{ cm}^2$, Remaining Area: $1868 \text{ cm}^2$
questions.solution:
Given: Tile dimensions $50 \times 70 \text{ cm}$. 8 triangles with sides $a=26, b=17, c=25$.

To find: Area of design and remaining area.

Explanation:
For one triangle:
$s = \frac{26+17+25}{2} = \frac{68}{2} = 34 \text{ cm}$.
Area of one triangle $= \sqrt{34(34-26)(34-17)(34-25)}$
$= \sqrt{34 \times 8 \times 17 \times 9}$
$= \sqrt{(17 \times 2) \times (4 \times 2) \times 17 \times 9}$
$= \sqrt{17^2 \times 2^2 \times 4 \times 9}$
$= 17 \times 2 \times 2 \times 3 = 204 \text{ cm}^2$.
Total Area of Design $= 8 \times 204 = 1632 \text{ cm}^2$.
Area of Tile $= 50 \times 70 = 3500 \text{ cm}^2$.
Remaining Area $= 3500 - 1632 = 1868 \text{ cm}^2$.

questions.question: A triangle and a parallelogram have the same base and the same area. If the sides of the triangle are $26 \text{ cm}, 28 \text{ cm}$ and $30 \text{ cm}$, and the parallelogram stands on the base $28 \text{ cm}$, find the height of the parallelogram.
questions.solution:
Given: Triangle sides $26, 28, 30$. Parallelogram base $28$. Areas are equal.

To find: Height of parallelogram.

Explanation:
For triangle: $s = \frac{26+28+30}{2} = \frac{84}{2} = 42 \text{ cm}$.
Area($\Delta$) $= \sqrt{42(42-26)(42-28)(42-30)}$
$= \sqrt{42 \times 16 \times 14 \times 12}$
$= \sqrt{(14 \times 3) \times 16 \times 14 \times (4 \times 3)}$
$= \sqrt{14^2 \times 3^2 \times 16 \times 4}$
$= 14 \times 3 \times 4 \times 2 = 336 \text{ cm}^2$.
Area of Parallelogram $= \text{Base} \times \text{Height} = 336$.
$28 \times h = 336$
$h = \frac{336}{28} = 12 \text{ cm}$.

questions.question: Two parallel sides of a trapezium are $60 \text{ m}$ and $77 \text{ m}$ and other sides are $25 \text{ m}$ and $26 \text{ m}$. Find the area of the trapezium.
questions.diagram: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 80' style='max-width:400px; display:block; margin:0 auto;'><path d='M 20 60 L 174 60 L 154 12 L 34 12 Z' fill='none' stroke='#333' stroke-width='2'/><text x='97' y='10' font-size='10' text-anchor='middle'>60 m</text><text x='97' y='75' font-size='10' text-anchor='middle'>77 m</text><text x='15' y='40' font-size='10' text-anchor='middle'>25 m</text><text x='175' y='40' font-size='10' text-anchor='middle'>26 m</text><line x1='34' y1='12' x2='34' y2='60' stroke='#999' stroke-dasharray='4'/><text x='40' y='40' font-size='10' fill='#555'>h</text></svg>
questions.solution:
Given: Parallel sides $a=77, b=60$. Non-parallel sides $c=25, d=26$.

To find: Area of trapezium.

Explanation:
Draw a line parallel to the side of $26 \text{ m}$ from the top vertex to the base. This forms a parallelogram with sides $60$ and $26$, and a triangle with sides $25, 26$ and base $(77-60) = 17 \text{ m}$.
For the triangle with sides $25, 26, 17$:
$s = \frac{25+26+17}{2} = \frac{68}{2} = 34 \text{ m}$.
Area($\Delta$) $= \sqrt{34(34-25)(34-26)(34-17)}$
$= \sqrt{34 \times 9 \times 8 \times 17}$
$= \sqrt{17 \times 2 \times 9 \times 8 \times 17}$
$= \sqrt{17^2 \times 16 \times 9} = 17 \times 4 \times 3 = 204 \text{ m}^2$.
Height of triangle $h = \frac{2 \times \text{Area}}{\text{Base}} = \frac{2 \times 204}{17} = 24 \text{ m}$.
This is also the height of the trapezium.
Area of Trapezium $= \frac{1}{2} (a+b) \times h$
$= \frac{1}{2} (60+77) \times 24 = 137 \times 12 = 1644 \text{ m}^2$.

questions.question: A rhombus shaped sheet with perimeter $40 \text{ cm}$ and one diagonal $12 \text{ cm}$, is painted on both sides at the rate of Rs $5$ per $\text{cm}^2$. Find the cost of painting.
questions.solution:
Given: Perimeter $= 40 \text{ cm}$, Diagonal $d_1 = 12 \text{ cm}$. Rate $=$ Rs $5$ per $\text{cm}^2$.

To find: Cost of painting both sides.

Explanation:
Side of rhombus $a = 40/4 = 10 \text{ cm}$.
Diagonals bisect at $90^\circ$. Let other diagonal be $d_2$.
$(\frac{d_1}{2})^2 + (\frac{d_2}{2})^2 = a^2$
$6^2 + (\frac{d_2}{2})^2 = 10^2$
$36 + (\frac{d_2}{2})^2 = 100 \Rightarrow (\frac{d_2}{2})^2 = 64 \Rightarrow \frac{d_2}{2} = 8 \Rightarrow d_2 = 16 \text{ cm}$.
Area of rhombus $= \frac{1}{2} \times d_1 \times d_2 = \frac{1}{2} \times 12 \times 16 = 96 \text{ cm}^2$.
Total area to paint (both sides) $= 2 \times 96 = 192 \text{ cm}^2$.
Cost $= 192 \times 5 = \text{Rs } 960$.

questions.question: Find the area of the quadrilateral $ABCD$ in which $AB = 7 \text{ cm}, BC = 6 \text{ cm}, CD = 12 \text{ cm}, DA = 15 \text{ cm}$ and $AC = 9 \text{ cm}$.
questions.diagram: <svg viewBox='0 0 200 150' style='max-width:300px; display:block; margin:0 auto;'><polygon points='50,130 170,130 50,40' fill='none' stroke='#333' stroke-width='1.5' /><polygon points='50,130 50,40 10,90' fill='none' stroke='#333' stroke-width='1.5' /><text x='45' y='140' font-size='10'>C</text><text x='175' y='140' font-size='10'>D</text><text x='50' y='35' font-size='10'>A</text><text x='5' y='95' font-size='10'>B</text><text x='110' y='140' font-size='10'>12</text><text x='115' y='80' font-size='10'>15</text><text x='55' y='90' font-size='10'>9</text><text x='25' y='65' font-size='10'>7</text><text x='30' y='120' font-size='10'>6</text></svg>
questions.solution:
Given: $AB=7, BC=6, CD=12, DA=15, AC=9$.

To find: Area of quadrilateral $ABCD$.

Explanation:
Area of Quad $ABCD$ = Area($\Delta ABC$) + Area($\Delta ADC$).
For $\Delta ABC$ (sides $7, 6, 9$):
$s_1 = \frac{7+6+9}{2} = 11 \text{ cm}$.
Area($\Delta ABC$) $= \sqrt{11(11-7)(11-6)(11-9)}$
$= \sqrt{11 \times 4 \times 5 \times 2} = \sqrt{440} = 2\sqrt{110} \text{ cm}^2$.
For $\Delta ADC$ (sides $15, 12, 9$):
Check for right angle: $9^2 + 12^2 = 81 + 144 = 225 = 15^2$.
So $\Delta ADC$ is a right-angled triangle at $C$.
Area($\Delta ADC$) $= \frac{1}{2} \times \text{base} \times \text{height} = \frac{1}{2} \times 12 \times 9 = 54 \text{ cm}^2$.
Total Area $= (54 + 2\sqrt{110}) \text{ cm}^2$.
(Approx $54 + 20.98 = 74.98 \text{ cm}^2$).

questions.question: The perimeter of a right triangle is $144 \text{ cm}$ and its hypotenuse is $65 \text{ cm}$. Find the lengths of other sides and calculate the area of the triangle.
questions.solution:
Given: Perimeter $= 144 \text{ cm}$, Hypotenuse $c = 65 \text{ cm}$.

To find: Other sides and Area.

Explanation:
Let the other two sides be $a$ and $b$.
$a + b + c = 144 \Rightarrow a + b = 144 - 65 = 79$.
Using Pythagoras theorem: $a^2 + b^2 = c^2 = 65^2 = 4225$.
We know $(a+b)^2 = a^2 + b^2 + 2ab$.
$79^2 = 4225 + 2ab$
$6241 = 4225 + 2ab$
$2ab = 6241 - 4225 = 2016 \Rightarrow ab = 1008$.
Area $= \frac{1}{2}ab = \frac{1}{2} \times 1008 = 504 \text{ cm}^2$.
To find sides, $a$ and $b$ are roots of $x^2 - (a+b)x + ab = 0$.
$x^2 - 79x + 1008 = 0$.
Discriminant $D = (-79)^2 - 4(1008) = 6241 - 4032 = 2209$.
$\sqrt{D} = 47$.
$x = \frac{79 \pm 47}{2}$.
$x_1 = \frac{126}{2} = 63$, $x_2 = \frac{32}{2} = 16$.
So the sides are $16 \text{ cm}$ and $63 \text{ cm}$.

questions.question: The sides of a triangular field are $41 \text{ m}$, $40 \text{ m}$ and $9 \text{ m}$. Find the number of rose beds that can be prepared in the field, if each rose bed, on an average needs $900 \text{ cm}^2$ space.
questions.solution:
Given: Sides $a=41 \text{ m}, b=40 \text{ m}, c=9 \text{ m}$. Space per bed $= 900 \text{ cm}^2$.

To find: Number of rose beds.

Explanation:
Check for right triangle: $40^2 + 9^2 = 1600 + 81 = 1681 = 41^2$.
So it is a right-angled triangle.
Area $= \frac{1}{2} \times \text{base} \times \text{height} = \frac{1}{2} \times 40 \times 9 = 180 \text{ m}^2$.
Convert to $\text{cm}^2$: $180 \text{ m}^2 = 180 \times 10000 = 1800000 \text{ cm}^2$.
Number of beds $= \frac{\text{Total Area}}{\text{Area per bed}} = \frac{1800000}{900} = 2000$.

questions.question: Calculate the area of the shaded region in the figure, where $\Delta ABC$ is an equilateral triangle with side $10 \text{ cm}$ and $\Delta DBC$ is right angled at $D$ with $BD = 8 \text{ cm}$.
questions.diagram: <svg viewBox='0 0 120 100' style='max-width:300px; display:block; margin:0 auto;'><polygon points='60,3.4 110,90 10,90' fill='#e0e0e0' stroke='#333' stroke-width='1.5'/><polygon points='74,42 110,90 10,90' fill='#fff' stroke='#333' stroke-width='1.5' stroke-dasharray='4'/><text x='60' y='15' font-size='8' text-anchor='middle'>A</text><text x='5' y='95' font-size='8'>B</text><text x='115' y='95' font-size='8'>C</text><text x='74' y='38' font-size='8'>D</text><text x='60' y='98' font-size='8' text-anchor='middle'>10 cm</text><text x='35' y='65' font-size='8' transform='rotate(-38 35,65)'>8 cm</text></svg>
questions.solution:
Given: $\Delta ABC$ is equilateral with side $10 \text{ cm}$. $\Delta DBC$ is right-angled at $D$ with $BD=8 \text{ cm}$.

To find: Area of shaded region (Area($ABC$) - Area($DBC$)).

Explanation:
Area of equilateral $\Delta ABC = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{4} (10)^2 = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{4} \times 100 = 25\sqrt{3} \text{ cm}^2$.
In right $\Delta DBC$, hypotenuse $BC = 10 \text{ cm}$.
$BC^2 = BD^2 + CD^2 \Rightarrow 100 = 8^2 + CD^2$
$100 = 64 + CD^2 \Rightarrow CD^2 = 36 \Rightarrow CD = 6 \text{ cm}$.
Area($\Delta DBC$) $= \frac{1}{2} \times BD \times CD = \frac{1}{2} \times 8 \times 6 = 24 \text{ cm}^2$.
Shaded Area $= \text{Area}(ABC) - \text{Area}(DBC) = (25\sqrt{3} - 24) \text{ cm}^2$.
$\approx 25(1.732) - 24 = 43.3 - 24 = 19.3 \text{ cm}^2$.
